H0.text: Earth has no natural satellites, distinguishing it from the other planets in the solar system that formed at about the same time from a large cloud of gas and dust and possess natural satellites.

H1.text: Earth's atmosphere is composed of gases, distinguishing it from other planets that formed at about the same time from a large cloud of gas and dust.

H2.text: Water is found in all three phases on Earth, distinguishing it from other planets that formed at about the same time from a large cloud of gas and dust.

H3.text: Volcanoes release liquid rock onto Earth's surface, a feature that distinguishes Earth from the other planets that formed at the same time from a large cloud of gas and dust.

A4.text: At the triple point, ice can exist together with both liquid water and vapor.

A5.text: Up to 99.63 Â°C (the boiling point of water at 0.1 MPa), at this pressure water exists as a liquid. Above that, it exists as water vapor.
